content.description:
Clip the first bolt just above a small overhang. Tackle tricky climbing just past second bolt. Continue past incut flakes to a double bolt anchor.

This route got a facelift and is newly equipped with stainless steel glue-in bolts.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a double bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is the first bolted route right of

Gritstone Arete

.

content.description: Climb alongside a thin, vertical seam.
content.location:
This is the second bolted line right of

Gritstone Arete

.

content.description: This is a great bouldery climb with a hand-to-foot match crux that requires you getting your hips up against the wall.
content.location:
It is 20 feet to the left of

Simple Physics

. Ascend a blank looking slab with 4 hard-to-spot glue-in bolts. This is the second bolted line to the left of the prominent corner.

content.description: This is the "other" arete route in this area.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a double bolt anchor.
content.location: It is on the far right side of the "brown wall".

content.description: Clip the first bolt, then make very difficult sidepulls off the incipient crack to get established on the headwall. Finish with thin, reachy climbing past two more bolts.
content.protection: Bolts to a double bolted anchor.
content.location: This is the third bolted line right of the large corner crack.

content.description: This seldom climbed crack just sprouted up a new finish. Climb the first splitter crack, then transfer onto the face clipping one bolt to the anchors!
content.protection: A few pieces from BD #2 - #4 and 1 quickdraw.
content.location:
This is left of the corner next to

Simple Physics

. Get calculated, and climb cracks. Clippin' more than 1 bolt is for fools.

content.description: Start off in the big hog corner, and start working it up! Plenty of footholds make this layback much easier.
content.protection: Bring your big stuff, we did it with a #2 - #6 (BD) one of each. You can toprope this, but then what are you doing with your life? It has a 2 bolt anchor with chains/rings.
content.location:
It is just right of the classic

Gritstone Arete

.

content.description: This has balancy climbing on a slightly less-than-vertical face.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a double bolt anchor.
content.location: It is just left of the large chimney at the left end of the "brown wall".

content.description: Climb up a series of positive holds, easier than it looks, and trend right round bolt 3-4! This is a good warm-up that some might say is one of the best for this wall.
content.location: Just ~25 feet left of the diehedral, look for positive flakes and holds.
